name: Tahuna Pod Hostel
description:
Tahuna Pod Hostel is located in the heart of Queenstown, New Zealand and offers affordable, premium accommodation in a relaxed atmosphere. 

Our facilities are modern, clean and spacious. We have onsite parking, free WIFI and offer a variety of single and queen pods as well as private rooms. This well-established hostel also features a large balcony with stunning views overlooking Queenstown. 

Guests have access to shared bathroom facilities, located on every floor.

Frequently Asked Questions:

1. Where is Tahuna Pod Hostel located?

We are located at 11 Henry Street in Queenstown which is only a 2-minute walk from the Stanley Street bus hub and a stone's throw from the centre of Queenstown.

2. What are your opening hours?

Our reception area is open daily from 7.00am to 10.00pm.

3. What are the check in and check out times?

Our check in time is from 2.00pm and our check out time is 10.00am.

6. Can I check in after 10.00PM?

Yes, if you have a booking and are checking in after 10.00pm, we have a late check in process. Please contact us if you will be checking in after 10.00pm so we can prepare for this.

7.  Do you allow children at the hostel?

As Tahuna Pod Hostel is shared accommodation we DO NOT ALLOW CHILDREN under the age of 18 to stay with us. We apologise for any inconvenience caused. 

8. How many people can sleep in one pod?

To ensure guest comfort and comply with occupancy regulations, EACH POD IS LIMITED TO ONE PERSON, whether it's a single or queen size.

If more than one person attempts to share a pod, you will be required to book an additional pod (subject to availability). If no extra pods are available, one guest will need to vacate the property, and no refunds will be given if all guests choose to leave. If more than one person does share a pod beyond the available beds and room occupancy, that additional person will be charged the full price for the bed. If payment cannot be taken from the additional person who slept in the guest's bed, the reservation allocated to that bed will be charged instead. 

We have private rooms available for couples.

9. Do you accept cash?

We do not accept cash at the hostel and can only take payment via card. Please note there is a 2% surcharge for all credit cards, international debit cards and payWave transactions, EFTPOS cards do not have a surcharge.

10. Do you have parking available?

We have onsite guest parking available for cars or small campervans at a daily rate of $20.00 for 24 hours (12pm - 12pm). The uncovered car park is located at the rear of the property and has a height limit of 2.5metres. Unfortunately, our car park cannot accommodate campervans, although public campervan parking options are down the road from the hostel at 5 Boundary Street. If you would like to park at the hostel, please reach out to us in advance to secure a spot, as spots are limited.

11. Do you have luggage storage? 

Yes, ask our friendly staff and we will point you in the right direction of our storage area.

12. Do you have bicycle storage?

Yes, we have free secure bike storage accessible by keypad and monitored by CCTV. If you would like to store your bicycle with us during your stay, we invite you to reach out to us prior to your arrival to secure a spot as spots are limited.

13. Do you have laundry facilities?

Yes, we have both washing machines and dryers. You'll need to purchase laundry tokens at reception for $2.00 a token. To wash, you'll need 2 tokens ($4.00) and for the dryer 1 token will give you 16 minutes - 3 tokens ($6.00) is usually sufficient.

Please note that we are a cashless hostel, however we can take card payments. There is a 2% surcharge for all credit cards, international debit cards and payWave transactions, EFTPOS cards do not have a surcharge. 

14. Do I need to bring linen?

No, you do not. We make all pods with clean linen (including duvets) and have towels for rent at reception for $3.

15. Do you offer long term stay?

Guests are allowed to stay for a maximum of 10 nights. 

16. What is the best way to get to/from the airport from Tahuna Pod Hostel?

AIRPORT TO HOSTEL (BUS)

The best way to get to the hostel from the Queenstown Airport is to catch the #1 bus from the airport to the Stanley Street Bus Hub. We are then a short 3-minute away. This bus departs from the airport every 15 minutes from 6:15am - 12:15am (midnight). A one-way ticket will cost $10 (cash only, paid to the driver) unless you purchase a reloadable 'Bee Card' for $10 ($5 card purchase, $5 credit) which can then be used for multiple bus rides. You can purchase a Bee Card at the airport from a store called Paper Plus, or from the bus driver but payment can only be with cash for this option. If you have a Bee Card, a one-way bus ride will then cost $2. 

HOSTEL TO AIRPORT (BUS)

To go to the airport from the hostel, you can catch the #1 bus from the Stanley Street Bus Hub, a 3-minute walk from the hostel. This bus departs every 15 minutes from 6:25am - 12:25am (midnight). A one-way ticket will cost $10 (cash only, paid to the driver) unless you purchase a reloadable 'Bee Card' for $10 ($5 card purchase, $5 credit) which can then be used for multiple bus rides. You can purchase a Bee Card from the i-SITE store in central Queenstown (22 Shotover Street), or from the bus driver but payment can only be with cash for this option. If you have a Bee Card, a one-way bus ride will then cost $2. 

OTHER OPTIONS

Another option for getting to/from the airport is to book a ticket with the Super Shuttle. This option is $20 for a one-way ticket which will drop you directly to the hostel/airport.

Alternatively, taxis will cost around $50 - $65. We recommend Queenstown Taxis for their reasonable and fair pricing.

17. Is WiFi available for guests?

Complimentary, high-speed WiFi is available for guests. We will provide you with the password on arrival. 

18. What is your cancellation policy?

Cancellations made 2 DAYS PRIOR to your arrival date will receive a full refund. 
Cancellations made WITHIN 2 DAYS of your arrival date will forfeit 100% of the total price paid.

houseRules.notes:
We reserve the right to change these booking terms and conditions at any time and without notice. Any future reservations or bookings you make will be made subject to the terms and conditions which apply at the time a booking is made and you are advised to read all terms and conditions carefully on each occasion prior to making a booking.

GROUP BOOKINGS
Any of our hostel rooms can be reserved exclusively for groups, subject to availability. The number of guests must not exceed the number of beds in the room. This policy will be strictly enforced. If more guests are present than the beds allow, additional booking fees will be charged if extra beds within the hostel are available. If no beds are available, the extra guests will be asked to leave the hostel.

If a group booking for over 8 guests is required, you must contact the hostel directly. Online reservations can only accommodate up to a maximum of 8 guests.

HEN & STAG PARTIES
To maintain a calm, respectful and inclusive atmosphere for hostel guests we do not allow hen and stag parties at the hostel. If a group checks in that appears to be a stag or hen party, we reserve the right to cancel the booking without refund.

MINIMUM AGE REQUIREMENT
To ensure a safe and enjoyable environment for all guests, Tahuna Pod Hostel has a STRICT 18+ POLICY. We do not accommodate anyone under 18, with no exceptions. All guests must provide valid ID at check-in to confirm their age. Failure to do so will result in denial of stay, and our cancellation/no-show policies will apply.

ACCEPTED CREDIT CARDS & FEES
We accept VISA, Mastercard, and Amex credit cards, as well as contactless PayWave payments, all of which incur a 2% surcharge. EFTPOS cards do not have a surcharge. Please note, we are a cash-free facility.

LUGGAGE STORAGE
Guests may leave their luggage in our luggage room located next to the lounge on level 1 however it remains the guest's responsibility to ensure that their personal belongings are secure at all times. Tahuna Pod Hostel accepts no liability for the loss, theft or damage to property however sustained or caused.

CHECK-IN PROCEDURE
All guests will be required to provide a credit card at hostel check-in to cover incidental charges & lost room keys.

You will also be required to present photo ID on arrival at the hostel. Valid photo identification that will be accepted is a passport, NZ drivers’ license, Kiwi Access Card (or HANZ card) and European Identity cards. Student IDs or foreign driving licenses will not be accepted as valid. Identification must not be expired, and copies will not be accepted.

CANCELLATION POLICY
You must notify Hostelworld as soon as possible if you wish to cancel or amend your booking. Cancellations of reservations made on STANDARD rates notified to Hostelworld within 2 days of the arrival date will forfeit 100% of the total price paid. Cancellations made 2 days prior to the arrival date will receive a full refund.

If you have booked a NON-REFUNDABLE rate, please note any cancellations or no shows will be charged in full and will not receive a refund. You may reschedule your stay for the same or higher price, subject to availability. You’ll only be charged extra if there’s a price difference between your new and old date. This will need to be arranged via Hostelworld.

NO-SHOW
In the case of a guest ‘no show’, the full amount of the booking will be charged to the credit card provided at the time of booking. The booking will be cancelled in its entirety at 0900 NZT on the morning after the reservation’s set arrival date. 

Cancellations made after (Check-in time) on the date of check-in will be processed as a ‘no show’ as above.

CHECK IN & CHECK OUT TIMES
Check-in begins at 2pm, although our reception is open from 7am to 10pm. New arrivals are welcome any time after 10am. While pods won’t be ready until 2pm, we offer secure luggage storage until your pod is available. Check-out is at 10am, but we’re happy to store your luggage in our locker room free of charge, and you’re welcome to use our facilities throughout the day. Late check-out is subject to availability, must be arranged in advance, and may incur additional charges.

CLEANING & DAMAGE TO THE PREMISES
Guests are responsible for any cleaning/damage to the premises or loss/damage to items and must cover the cost of repair or replacement. A minimum fee of $150 will be charged for damages, with additional costs applied as needed, including lost revenue for rooms made unusable. This also applies to excessive cleaning required due to misuse of the room or premises.

DISABLED GUESTS
Guests with special requirements related to a disability are encouraged to inform the hostel's management team prior to their arrival. Please note that only select rooms are wheelchair accessible. To ensure we can accommodate your needs, please contact the hostel directly before making a reservation to discuss the available options.

SOCIAL CODE
For a peaceful stay for all, Tahuna Pod Hostel kindly asks that you respect quiet hours between 10pm and 8am. Please keep noise to a minimum during this time. If we receive a noise complaint, it will serve as a first warning. Repeated disturbances may result in being asked to leave and your reservation being cancelled.

SMOKING
Smoking is not permitted anywhere on the premises; this includes on balconies and external areas. This also includes the usage of electronic cigarettes, vapes, candles, incense sticks or any other device emitting fumes by the combustion of any material or substance.

ALCOHOL CONSUMPTION
Please note that alcohol consumption is not allowed after 10pm in rooms or common areas, including balconies. Drunken behaviour will not be tolerated, and intoxicated guests will be asked to leave. Alcohol consumption is always at the discretion of Tahuna Pod Hostel staff.

DRUG USE
The possession and use of illegal drugs are not permitted on our site and if discovered will result in immediate eviction without a refund.

PETS
Assistance dogs, such as guide dogs, hearing dogs, and dogs for those who are disabled, are permitted. Otherwise, we uphold a strict no pets policy.

FIRE ALARM ACTIVATION
If the fire alarm is activated intentionally or unnecessarily, or due to smoking/vaping or prohibited electrical devices, the person responsible will be billed for the cost of the fire service response. The Tahuna Pod Hostel fire system is directly linked to the Fire Service, which will respond whenever the alarms are triggered.

LOST PROPERTY
If you leave an item behind during your stay, please email Tahuna Pod Hostel with a detailed description of the item, its location, and the date it was forgotten. We will make every effort to locate it and address your request within 48 hours, though we cannot guarantee recovery. We will inform you within 48 hours if the item is found; if so, you can arrange pickup, or we can send it to you at your expense. Tahuna Pod Hostel is not responsible for lost or forgotten items and cannot guarantee they will be found. Any found items will be recorded and kept for 30 days.

CHRISTMAS BOOKINGS
All bookings between 24th December and 26th December are considered Christmas Bookings. A minimum stay of 2 nights is required, including the 24th, 25th and 26th December, with check-in on or before the 24th and check-out on or after the 27th. We do not allow check-ins or check-outs on the 25th or 26th, but you may book and pay for the extra dates if you wish to leave early.

All bookings during this period are non-refundable. 

NEW YEARS EVE BOOKINGS
All bookings from 30th December to 2nd January are considered New Year's Eve Bookings. A minimum stay of 4 nights is required, including New Year's Eve and New Year's Day, with check-in on or before 31st December and check-out after 2nd January. Check-ins and check-outs are not available on the 1st and 2nd January, but you may book extra dates and leave early if desired.

Whilst NYE is a time for celebration, and we want everyone to enjoy themselves, we also want everyone to feel comfortable at the hostel and have a good night's sleep. Therefore, we will be enforcing a 'No Alcohol' policy after 10PM over the dates of 30/12/24 to 01/01/25. This will ensure that those who sleep after this time won't be disturbed. Violating this policy will result in an immediate removal without a refund. We trust that the reasons for this policy are clear.

In addition, drunken behaviour and abuse will not be tolerated, and disorderly guests will be asked to leave. This is for the comfort and safety of all guests and staff.

All bookings during this period are non-refundable.
